item.title: Another Day Of Game Dev
item.description:
After a long day at my day job and some family time I started work on Violent Sol. With our first internal release coming up it is important to get the finishing touches on on what really is a robust system with a simple little game built in. The amount of interaction really is just shooting bugs on a top down forest and picking health orbs.

This may seem like a small thing but most of our work for the past 3 months or so has been on building the foundation for a truly epic game in scope. Here are our features so far.

  • Structure of the universe that can support planet play, space, and even other dimensions.
  • Stream loading content cache that should keep our game in a small memory foot print.
  • 100% modable Entity system that can load external DLL and configs to add to the game.
  • Rendering system that allows for thousands of entities on the screen.
  • Simple but extendable GUI system that allows for unlimited layered rendering and control input
  • Client / Universe model that allows for easy network code in the near future
  • Simple but flexible animation system based on simple sprite sheets
  • The start of a simple analytics engine
  • A failed Kickstarter campaign
  • A successful Geenlit campaign
  • A Lot more that I am forgetting right now

So we are speeding along to what is one awesome engine and a simple game to release to family, friends, and coworkers. It is worth every hour.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Welcome all to my little corner of the Internet. Since this is sort of my first official post let me give you the low down on who I am. I am a father and software developer, in that order. My day job for the time being is both web development and automation. My true passion in my software is Game Development. Now that we have the intro out of the way lets dive in to what I do where.

Web Development

My training and bulk of my experience has been in the world of Desktop Application(as in compiles a binary) and Systems Development. In the last few years I have branched out in to Web Development. It has been fun and presents a whole new set of challenges.

Automation

So you might have read that text above and wondered what I meant by automation. It is some what a vague term so allow me to explain. What I mean by automation is using software to automate other software or business processes. The bulk of my work has been in the application testing space. This is using sets of tools and custom code to test web sites or desktop applications.

Game Development

O the mighty and awesome challenge of building virtual experiences. I have a love for creating entire worlds with in small digital devices. It is the reason I started my track in to software development. My speciality is Game Architecture, but I love most jobs in this field. Just don’t ask this poor coder to hand you art, your game characters will turn in to small squares.

So that sums up my professional life. For the most part that is all this little blog will cover. There might be a few cameo posts about my thoughts and feelings but this will not include family and friends. Check back often.
